- it did not come up
- got the following in the log

I'm including the other SWT fragments in the product file, so they end up
referenced in the config.ini.  However, I don't have the delta pack installed,
so the fragments for the other platforms are missing. But it looks like runtime
is successfully ignoring these, and is looking for the right platform DLL.

However, it's looking for the wrong version of it.  It should be going for
swt-win32-3128.  This is what build I20050401-1200, and also what is in my
workspace (both the DLL and the Library class have 128).
Not sure where it's getting the 127 from.

Hmm.  My org.eclipse.swt.win32 project has grown a @dot folder, under which
version.txt has:
version 3.127.  No other files contain 127, except for presumably false matches
in a few .class files.

I reloaded org.eclipse.swt.win32 from head, re-exported and it then worked fine.
I suspect it was getting a stale Library class from under the @dot folder.
Not sure how this folder got created.  

Does the export create this?
who knows why Pascal does anything? ;-)

with pde/ui passing a good resolved state to pde/build, this should all be 
ancient history.
